intro: Oplonia jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom throughout the year in warm climates. Oplonia jamaicensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
